meanings.definition: Breed (an animal) with one not of the same strain or family.
meanings.sent1: The farmer decided to outcross his cows with a neighboring farmer's bull.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to outcross different breeds of dogs to maintain genetic diversity.
meanings.sent3: The chickens were surprised when the rooster tried to outcross with a duck!
meanings.sent4: In the world of gardening, sometimes it's beneficial to outcross different plant varieties.
meanings.sent5: The scientist explained how important it is to outcross to prevent inbreeding in the population.

meanings.definition: A cross between animals not closely related.
meanings.sent1: The outcross of the two horse breeds resulted in a unique and strong offspring.
meanings.sent2: The zoo introduced an outcross of two different species to observe their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The outcross of the cat and the raccoon in the cartoon made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The outcross of the lion and the tiger created a majestic hybrid animal.
meanings.sent5: The outcross of the two bird species led to a fascinating blend of colors in the offspring.
